Sentencas: The perovskite series Sr2CoNb1-xTixO6-delta (0 <= x <= 1) was investigated in the full compositional range to assess its potential as cathode material for solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC).
Titulo: Defect Chemistry, Electrical Properties, and Evaluation of New Oxides Sr2CoNb1-xTixO6-δ (0 ≤ x ≤ 1) as Cathode Materials for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The variation of transport properties and thus, the area specific resistances (ASR) are explained by a detailed investigation of the defect chemistry.
Titulo: Defect Chemistry, Electrical Properties, and Evaluation of New Oxides Sr2CoNb1-xTixO6-δ (0 ≤ x ≤ 1) as Cathode Materials for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Increasing the titanium content from x = 0-1 produces both oxidation of Co3+ to Co4+ (from 0 up to 40%) and oxygen vacancies (from 6.0 to 5.7 oxygen atom/formula unit), although each charge compensation mechanism predominates in different compositional ranges.
Titulo: Defect Chemistry, Electrical Properties, and Evaluation of New Oxides Sr2CoNb1-xTixO6-δ (0 ≤ x ≤ 1) as Cathode Materials for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Neutron diffraction reveals that samples with high Ti-contents lose a significant amount of oxygen upon heating above 600 K. Oxygen is partially recovered upon cooling as the oxygen release and uptake show noticeably different kinetics.
Titulo: Defect Chemistry, Electrical Properties, and Evaluation of New Oxides Sr2CoNb1-xTixO6-δ (0 ≤ x ≤ 1) as Cathode Materials for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The complex defect chemistry of these compounds, together with the compositional changes upon heating/cooling cycles and atmospheres, produce a complicated behavior of electrical conductivity.
Titulo: Defect Chemistry, Electrical Properties, and Evaluation of New Oxides Sr2CoNb1-xTixO6-δ (0 ≤ x ≤ 1) as Cathode Materials for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Cathodes containing Sr2CoTiO6-delta display low ASR values, 0,13 Omega cm(2) at 973 K, comparable to those of the best compounds reported so far, being a very promising cathode material for SOFC.
Titulo: Defect Chemistry, Electrical Properties, and Evaluation of New Oxides Sr2CoNb1-xTixO6-δ (0 ≤ x ≤ 1) as Cathode Materials for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells
